<@U6TTP7EUV|daniel.b.garcia> has joined the channel
so with the time for coming together approaching, where should we sit? I can set up a zoom meeting (which is quite nice and has both phone and client call in)
looks over at his busted teleporter
I wouldn't suggest requiring software installs for the meeting!
what time is it exactly and whats on the agenda?
17:30 BST start.
Which is in 16 minutes.

The agenda is:
1. Introductions.
2. Discussion of proposal documents.
3. Discussion of any other issues.
good, the one gordon made?
No - the one that was discussed here earlier in the week.
I've increased the detail level a bit.
is there a link for it?
Just throwing it through a last-minute spell-check :slightly_smiling_face:
I can help
if only I could code as fast as I spot typos heh
<@U6Q92JWHY|peterclark> uploaded a file: <https://postriak.slack.com/files/peterclark/F6TVB0B29/riak_community_proposal_-_2017-08-25_-_v0.1.pdf|Riak Community Proposal - 2017-08-25 - v0.1.pdf>
I took Gordon's one, my one and the feedback from people here.
no doubt
I fully expect this to get torn to shred's, by the way.
I like your confidence, I am the kind to shred things down to 4-5 things
Well, the idea is for the best idea to win :slightly_smiling_face:
In this, I have no ego, fear not!
let's start with that, what is the idea?

Well:

```6.	Aims
The aim of this project is to provide:
	A canonical open source version of source code for Riak.
	Tested installation packages of Riak for supported OSs.
	Canonical documentation on how to use Riak.
	Product information on when and why to use Riak.
	A public and easily understood minimalist structure. 
```
if we have a unified idea like russell was saying, I think that would lend a lot to a shared focus and productivity
Yes - liked the idea of a project ethos. Just not sure what that would be! I'm hoping he will elaborate.
It's basically those kind of aims like you listed, distilled into one overarching principle
This document is more how I think we should go about the project, not the details of what should be built.
I tend to go with Bill & Ted: "Be excellent to each other. And, party on, dude."
peterclark do you have a prefered meeting platform? If not I’ll just make a zoom thingy. We should start setting it up to give people time to prepare before the clock ticks 30
What does Zoom give us that Slack does not?
Oh, right. We can’t do audio on this Slack
Can we?
I thought that was Pro only
does slack have voice thingies?
I think you have to pay to get that.
Yes.
oh I dind’t know that
it says “only payed teams” :disappointed:
peterclark I’ve no special love for zoom :stuck_out_tongue: It’s just all I know
Plus if we do audio, we’ll need to record it
Not insurmountable
Not to mention the fun of having a bunch of new people who don't know each other's voices on a conference call.
And it will need to be preserved here, or we’ll lose it in the 10k message limit
I find text a lot harder to keep track of in a converstation but I will cope then :wink:
So do I, but I think it's probably the best solution so far.
We should make extensive use of threads, I think!
How does that work?
Please keep in mind not everyone is a slack expert
Click "start a thread" on the right of the message.
So this would be a reply in the thread.
When you finish the thread, you send the result back to the main window.
So this is the conclusion.

text: <@U6Q92JWHY|peterclark> pinned a message to this channel.
Anyone who wants to introduce themselves, go ahead now.
customary that you start :wink:
I'm Peter Clark, of TI Tokyo in Japan. My company provides enterprise-grade worldwide support to Riak end-users.
The nice thing about text is that we can all type at once for common questions like that.
Mark Allen, formerly of Basho, currently of Alert Logic. Alert Logic had a support contract w/ Basho.
We use Riak rather extensively
I'm Stuart Whitfield, Erlang Solutions CEO. We do anything and everything connected to the Erlang ecosystem. We've been a Risk reseller/support provider/consultancy from the early days
(we could start a thread so we can sidebar)
Azhar Nisar, Tech Lead,  NHS Digital, England, we use Riak as backend product for NHS Spine
Heinz Gies, I run Project-FiFo and a the database and cloud orchestration I build based on riak_core (no riak itself however). I also currently maintain the riak_core(_ng) package in hex.
I'm Steve Roberts from Erlang Solutions. We were/are a Riak distibutor and we have customers still on Riak so want to ensure it has a future.
Russell Brown, formerly of Basho, currently selling my Riak skills/knowledge and developing Riak to/for the NHS
Bill Smargiassi, former Basho CSE, currently working with TI Tokyo
Anyone else?

Hi to all, I'm Gianluca Padovani from Italy. I have a small company in Italy Coders51 and we are developing in Erlang/Elixir I'm very interested in riak technologies and I would contribute as a developer
no one from bet365?
I thought b365 were joining
Would have been handy, but we can always forward them the results by email. This is just the first step in the process!

We are seeing them shortly to get their thoughts on a range of topics around this so it would be good to have a consolidated community view (incomplete and ad hoc as it will be initially) on what's important and I'll happily discuss with them
Great.

Pedram Nimreezi, CTO for a social network and bank in Miami. I consult through my firm ZEN (Zen Enterprise Networks), I teach Wing Chun Kung Fu most nights and am involved with Code for America (Miami and Fort Lauderdale).
OK - I think that's all the introduction's we're going to get.

I'm +1 on the aims section

I'd also like to identify and contact the major enterprise users who, arguably, have the biggest commercial interest in this project and contact them to ensure active participation (or a firm 'no, we don't want to participate'). We know who they are and now we have at least some more certainty re IPR we can contact them all. Getting them on board now will mean a better outcome and potentially greater resources to ensure the community can deliver on its plans for Riak. This will be an OSS project but will need some commercial funding too

The idea is that the Project Direction Group says "we want XYZ". The Developers figure out how, and the Release Management Group sanity check it and make a release.
If a Developer wanted a new backend, just propose it to the Project Direction Group and it goes in the stack of things to get built.
<@U6Q92JWHY> often developers 80% make things first, and then it would go to product to decide if needs finishing, but I get your meaning

yes it should be clearly governed however

In which case the Project Direction Group essentially has two hats.
It just feels good to have a saveguard against crazy
So we split them as Stuart(?) suggested.
There's always a trade off between strict governance to create a single version and encouraging innovation/flexiblity. If governance is too restrictive then Riak will fragment/fork.
Yes. I'd have Governance as part of the Admin Group, and chosen by the Project Direction Group.
Governance would then do the safety checks.
I.e. Project Direction Group is the board, Governance is the executive.

It probably doesn’t matter for most small stuff, but just someone doing a sanity check, on “yes we want that company/group as part of our directional board” makes sense, every other office is elected so we get that checks there automatically.
<@U6Q92JWHY> has a layout like this been used before with any other groups?

Inserting:
```9.4.3.	Governance Team
In charge of:
	Executing the vision laid down by the Project Direction Group.
	Co-ordinating between Groups and Teams.
```
<@U6S4RDVEE> - no idea. I just went with what I thought was best.
I did read up on a few others but most of them seems to have a lot more overhead.
I think it’s good to start off with little overhead, it’s always easy to grow more complex but very hard to simplify
Also easy to grow wrong :slightly_smiling_face:
I've been researching a lot into management cybernetics, theres some valuable insight on reducing oscillation between groups and teams..  This is not a new problem by any means
```	Checks new build works as expected.```

So:

```9.2.10.	Build Team
	Receive work packet from Documentation Team.
	Creates build process.
	Checks new build works as expected.
	Either releases new version to the public, or returns to the Development Group team for fixes.
```
so reading through it all in all I think it’s a really great starting point

When Basho was alive - the direction / roadmap was a result of customers buying the product and influencing the roadmap. This is being market driven demand is being lost. If a company funds the development of a feature (either publicly or privately) then I guess it should by default be included in the Product Direction.
How would changes to the process happen? Say we just took this today, how weould we go about changing something we found worked or didn’t work
the membership management seems a little lottery/game theory to me
I think not nessessariy, some features might come with an incredibly high maintainaince/longterm overhead which we might not want to carry just because someone initially sponsored it.

As I see it, they would propose a new feature, the PDG would discuss how (or if) it fits with Riak. If they decide it doesn't it either gets added as low priority or it happens in a company-specific fork.
That sounds like most of the basho added features tbf. It's best if we don't think of Riak as a good template imo
We would have to have a review process in place going to Governance, which then got voted on by the relevant Team or Group or everyone.
I have experience with riak_test
Yap, something along the lines. Review process should be part of the charter (I call it that  now :P) so it ‘protects itself’ in a way.
I imagine that it will take some refining to get it going smoothly.
Handy!
Makes sense.
That will go in the next revision!

We might also want to schedule a fixed review time ahead of time that forces us to consider if things work. At least for the first year or so that we’re not growing complacent and just accept it because calling for a get together is so much work.

From the PDG it will be fairly high level ("make replication work between datacenters".
The Developers would then break it down into smaller parts.

I think a key thing is some guiding principles for product direction.  Riak started off aiming to be bullet proof and do something well. It's lost direction over time and things which were probably a good idea but half baked ended up being released (eg Yokuzuna).  There are plenty of companies using Riak because it's a mission critical application - I think we need to get back to basics and do things well. So document needs a "mission statement" I suppose for Riak direction.

Next Fiday, same time, new channel.
I think we all need a bit of time to digest it
sounds good
I'll make a markdown version in GitHub for easy editing.
can we download the content of the channel to preserve it?
Not going to delete it.
Just start a new clean channel for next meeting.
it will get deleted due to the message limit
Oh - free version.
Good point.
yup
the few things I know about slack (due to having run into it :P)
I’m working on preserving this in JSON
give me a bit, I'll bring in my chat bot from irc
<@U6SUK860N> - great!
Well, whoever gets there first, send me the log :slightly_smiling_face:
Tools seem pretty easy
yea slack is extensible
its just a bit capitalistic compared to my beloved IRC :smile:
I am probably the among oldest nerds alive who never really got into IRC
Eventually we should have some standardized infra, I understand that in the beginning it’s not ideal either but evntually I would love to move to a voice (or voice/videa) system.
(for those whom it made sense)
<@U6SUK860N> its not too late :smile:
imagine a chat client that doesn't use a gig of ram
I still have a ICQ handle :slightly_smiling_face:
368047 :slightly_smiling_face:
I DO TOO!
i just don't remember my damn password
Same here!
rofl
And the email address is gone LONG ago.
wow you got yours really early
:slightly_smiling_face:
What can I say, I had a misspent childhood.
low integer envies
:slightly_smiling_face:
yeah now its a weird useless number permanently stored in my brain for some reason
Yup.
Right - g'night all!
thanks for the hard work
I fear it is just the beginning :slightly_smiling_face:
yes, you have awoken dragons.
Thanks again <@U6Q92JWHY>
Good? :slightly_smiling_face:
Bye
Bye.
night peterclark thanks for the great document!
Have made a public repo and a Markdown version of the document. Available at <https://github.com/TI-Tokyo/riak-community-admin>.

text: I have started a new channel (<#C6TD30YTA|planning-2017-09-01>) for our next meeting and pinned the link in there, too.
